credentials: PHD  University of Texas at Austin
name: Rishab GOYAL

ratings.comment:
Rishab is a great professor, knowledgeable and organized. HWs are hard but you have 2 weeks to write them, and will give out useful hint during lecture. Office hour is a MUST to do well in homework, TAs for this course are also knowledgeable and helpful throughout the semester.
Cryptography is a hard topic, don't blame the professor for it lol

I will state first that I will not give a low grade for a course being too difficult;

Rishab knows what he is talking about in class and his summaries and course organization are very clear. Therefore, I think this course is a good course for those who are willing to spend a little time thinking, you think, instead of mindlessly writing code.
He knows the material very well but is not good at explaining them in an undergraduate level. The homework takes way too long (15+ hours) and I really grinded hard to get an A in this class.

Crypto is one of the hardest classes Ive taken at UW, but Prof. Goyal did a good job breaking the content down into small pieces in lecture and encouraged participation. That being said  The class was at a level far beyond what I &others were expecting, but I think that is more the fault of the CS department to give us an adequate math foundation.

While Professor Goyal is very smart and gets better through the semester, he has trouble explaining topics at an undergrad level but would be great for a grad course. The class is astronomically hard with the problem sets taking >20 hours to do and impossible without help from the TAs. Goyal isn't a bad lecturer, but the class is extremely hard.
He isn't super organized, but he is an entertaining lecturer and he is super passionate about cryptography.

Knows what he is talking about. Went to MIT and is very intelligent. Problem is he teaches an MIT level class as an intro class. If you take this class office hours is a must. I'm sure he would be a great teacher for a higher level class, but he doesn't seem to understand that most of the people in his class have never taken a crypto class before

He clearly understands what he is teaching but he is very poor at getting the main points of concepts across in class. On top of this he is rather disorganized when it comes to how the course is set up. For instance, we didn't find out when the first midterm was until we were over a month into the class. Overall, I would not taking class with him.

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS! Goyal is a terrible lecturer and while he encourages participation, his responses are pretty toxic to "wrong" answers. Homeworks are nothing like the lectures or textbook. Lectures recorded but attendance tracked by gps. The mean score for ps1 was 79%
Terrible at lecturing. Inept at teaching in general.
